name: Better Tile
note: A more efficient way to draw a tile map.

name: Bouncing Polygons
note: Bounce convex polygons off of a non-axis aligned line.

name: Polygon Basics
note: A good place to get started with 2D polygons.

name: GJK Collision
note: There is no video for this project (yet).

name: Polygon Rotation
note: There is no video for this project.

name: Hitbox
note: Showcases moving hitboxes, tunneling, and non-tile based platforming.

name: Vector Math
note: There are multiple videos that go with this example. How do you get to them? I haven't implemented that functionality yet.

name: Particle Pool
note: Use object pooling to conserve memory when using lots of objects.

name: Simple Inventory
note: A very basic inventory system where you click an item to take it out of the world and put it into an array.

name: Tile Animation
note: Animate some background tiles based on frame rate.

name: Rectangle Collision
note: Collision between two rectangles.

name: Moving Platforms
note: Moving platforms for a 2D platforming game.

name: Platformer AI
note: Shows how to make a few different AI types for a tile based platformer.

name: Shoot
note: Very basic shooting mechanism for 2D platformers. Click to shoot.

name: Scrolling Tile Background
note: Showcases a scrolling tile background as well as some very simple terrain interaction.

name: 3D Cube
note: A 3D cube rendered on the CPU using nothing but pure JavaScript

name: Pseudo 3D Starfield
note: A 2D starfield with a 3D effect. Uses a valid 3D projection technique.

name: Bouncing Balls
note: Bouncing balls that use directional/polar movement rather than axis aligned movement.

name: Basic HTML Layout
note: My basic layout for projects. Provides a good starting point for small projects.

name: Circle Collision Response
note: Collision response technique for colliding circles.

name: Circle Collision Detection
note: Detect collision between two circles.

name: Input Processing Output (IPO)
note: I'm probably going to remove this one. It kind of makes sense, but I'm not sure how relevant or helpful it is.

name: Rabbit Trap
note: There are a few videos on this project. It's basically a how to build a platformer series that probably has too much overhead for what it is. I'm planning on redoing this one.

name: Pre-Scale Performance
note: Tests out the performance of different scaling techniques. As of 2019, I prefer using CSS to scale.

name: Tile Graphics
note: Draw graphics to your tile map.

name: Pagination
note: Paginates some static content.

name: Dominique's Doors
note: A very basic level loading example using JSON.

name: JSON
note: A basic JSON example.

name: Calculator
note: Make a JavaScript calculator. Note: It uses eval to calculate equations.

name: Blit
note: Blitting graphics.

name: Dino Run
note: A simple endless runner.

name: Sprite Animation
note: Animate moving objects to make your game more interesting.

name: Load Image
note: Load an image.

name: Tile Types
note: There are multiple videos for this example. This example covers the various types of tiles one might use in a 2D platformer.

name: Snake
note: The classic snake game.

name: Top Down Tiles
note: Top down tile based collision detection and response.

name: Hit The Wall
note: 2D platformer tile based collision detection and response.

name: Walk On Tiles
note: Interact with the tile grid using the player and your keyboard.

name: Indexed DB
note: An example that shows how to use Indexed DB.

name: Offline Web App
note: Store the files your app needs in the browser so you can run your app offline.

name: Web App
note: Create a web app that can run in full screen mode on any device.

name: HTTPS Server
note: Make an HTTPS server in Node JS.

name: Touch Controller
note: Make a responsive touch controller for your mobile game.

name: Tile Grid
note: Learn about tile map indexing and how to find your place in the map.

name: Tile World
note: Tile World

name: Square Collision Response
note: Square Collision

name: Collision
note: Collision

name: Control
note: Control

name: Animation Game Loop
note: Animation

name: Canvas
note: How to use HTML5 canvas

name: Elements
note: Working with HTML elements.

name: Multiple-Inheritance
note: Shows one way to approach multiple inheritance. I later discovered that this approach copies all parent properties, which is different from true inheritance. True inheritance uses the same properties rather than cloning them. I have still found this to be a useful technique that achieves a similar effect.

name: Prototype Inheritance
note: Shows prototype inheritance in JS

name: Inheritance
note: Shows basic class inheritance

name: Objects And Vars
note: Shows variable declaration in JavaScript

name: Hello World
note: A simple hello world example
